name: IpDenseVector
brief:
Dense vector implementation storing contiguous Number arrays

DenseVector is the primary Vector implementation in Ipopt.
Two storage modes:
- Heterogeneous: Full array of values (Values() method)
- Homogeneous: Single scalar repeated for all elements (Scalar() method)

algorithms.name:
Homogeneous Vector Optimization:
  When all elements have same value (e.g., initialization to 1.0),
  stores only scalar_ instead of n-element array. Transparently
  expands to full storage when heterogeneous access needed.
  Saves O(n) memory and enables O(1) operations on uniform vectors.
algorithms.math:
BLAS-backed operations for heterogeneous vectors:
  - Axpy: y ← αx + y via DAXPY
  - Dot: x^T·y via DDOT
  - Nrm2: ||x||_2 via DNRM2
  All other operations use optimized element-wise loops.
algorithms.complexity:
O(n) for most operations on heterogeneous vectors.
  O(1) for operations on homogeneous vectors (scalar multiply, etc.).

Check IsHomogeneous() before accessing values to use appropriate method.

Features:
- Efficient BLAS operations via IpBlas wrappers
- Metadata support for debugging (variable names)
- DenseVectorSpace factory for creating compatible vectors

Operations delegate to BLAS for performance when heterogeneous.
